alert.note: Alert for Barry (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued December 17 at 6:42PM CST until December 18 at 12:45AM CST by NWS Springfield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Springfield has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southern Barry County in southwestern Missouri... * Until 1245 AM CST Saturday. * At 642 PM CST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area as storms move in from Arkansas. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. This warning includes Roaring River State Park. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Roaring River State Park, Seligman, Washburn, Shell Knob, Golden, Emerald Beach, Eagle Rock, Chain-O-Lakes and Arrow Point. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
